header: The Nordic Perl Workshop was announced and events are listed at the end of the newsletter. I hope you will find something near-by!

Does your company have a Perl job opening that you would like to see mentioned in the Perl Weekly? - You can have that in a sponsored entry right at the top of each edition. See one from Grant Street Group below. For details how to get mentioned, please contact me.
In any case, enjoy the articles!

entries.title: We're Hiring Telecommuters - Grant Street Group
entries.text:
We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications.
We're looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Email resume: 106686-CS-6734@grantstreet.hrmdirect.com

entries.title: Perl Search Revisited
entries.text: A while ago Dave Cross built a Google-based search engine, specifically for Perl sites. It just got a new facelift.

entries.title: Nordic Perl Workshop 2013
entries.text: This year te workshop will take place in Copenhagen, Denmark on November 23, 2013.

entries.title: RT 4.2.0 released
entries.text: RT = Request Tracker. The software that runs rt.cpan.org among other things.

entries.title: Dada Mail v6.7.0 Released! Save as Draft, Enhanced Attachments, jQuery Plugin
Comma quibbling in Perl
entries.text: Sinan Unur shows his example to this special cases of joining some strings together. Taken from Rosetta Code.

entries.title: ImProveD prove
entries.text: hen developing Perl, how can you focus on the tests that are currently failing? Can you easily pick the onese that failed in the previous run? Gianluca Casati explains how to do that.

entries.title: Docs For Modules In Your Pinto Repository
entries.text: Andy Gorman created a module called Pinto::Action::Doc that allows you to see the documentation of each module right in the Pinto repository.

entries.title: the perl 5.10 lexical topic
entries.text: Ricardo Signes, the current Pumpking of Perl 5 shows what problems does a 'my $_' solve and what new problems does it create. He explain why did this feature became experimental, roughly 6 years after it was introduced in perl 5.10.

entries.title: CPAN adoption leaderboard
entries.text: Neil Bowers list the people who have adopted modules from his list, but really this information should be available on MetaCPAN and in both direction. Listing the heros who adopted modules in one place, but also showing who created the module in the first place and who contributed to it during the years.

entries.title: Planet Moose - September 2013
entries.text: The monthly Moose report by Toby Inkster covers everything related to the Moose/Moo/p5-mop. Almost everything object oriented related in Perl.

entries.title: Perl impressions after YAPC::EU 2013
entries.text: Paweł Król from XING visited YAPC::EU in Kiev. He has some very strong opinion on some of the speakers and about the whole perl versioning debate.

entries.title: Debugging Perl with hdb
entries.text: Devel::hdb is a visual perl debugger that displays your script in a browser where you can step through the code, set breakpoints and inspect variables.

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.
